title: elevates
author: elevates
created_time: March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PMLast edit: March 09, 2023, 12:40:04 PM by elevates
content: I find happiness whenever I see a project meant to solve world issues as Bitcoin did and has been doing. I have been tracking the progress of a few projects but I am not happy with the outcome for now. Maybe in the future, they might gear up and prove they are worthy of investment. Below are the three projects that I am following and I want to know whether they are worthy of investment. I know if they succeed in the smallest margin they would maximize my investment.   1.Sentinel2.Akash3.DysonWhich one do you think is good enough for 2-3 years of investment and for a short-term return on investment? Edit: It seems a lot of members here are not aware of these three projects. I also assumed that you might be able to just do a google search about them but unfortunately, no one did and that is the reason I have added links for you guys to know more about them.If you know any projects similar to them in their initial phase then do leave your comment tagging me.[/list]

comments.author: Yogee
comments.body: New project solving real world issues? I don't know. There are many that claims they can provide solution to this and that but sometimes blockchain isn't even necessary. There are also many claims of solving scaling problems in a decentralized manner but couldn't deliver that promise. Much of the coins and tokens that exists today doesn't really offer something new also.Quote from: elevates on March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PMBelow are the three projects that I am following and I want to know whether they are worthy of investment. I know if they succeed in the smallest margin they would maximize my investment.   SentinelAkashDysonWhich one do you think is good enough for 2-3 years of investment and for a short-term return on investment? If you have any other in your mind then do list them with your reason for investing. Please do give me an ROI timeframe.I don't know anything about them. I haven't been looking for a new project to be fair and haven't followed updates of more established coins for a considerable time. There are more productive things to do right now but I will probably start again after the second or third quarter of the year.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PMWhich one do you think is good enough for 2-3 years of investment and for a short-term return on investment? Tbh i've never heard of any of these three coins/projects, but since i am not really interested in new projects i don't look out for them. Do you mind elaborating why you think these projects have any sustainability, and are different from the usual scam projects with fake promises and no utility.Quote from: elevates on March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PMIf you have any other in your mind then do list them with your reason for investing. Please do give me an ROI timeframe.In response to this question, users are basically going to tell you to invest in projects that they have invested in, maybe the more people that buy it, then the higher the chances of the project pumping (only to dump later). I'd advice you stay away from pump and dump projects and stop gambling with new cryptocurrencies, it could be really risky.Quote from: elevates on March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PMI find happiness whenever I see a project meant to solve world issues as Bitcoin did and has been doing.You'd be better off sticking with Bitcoin.

comments.author: livingfree
comments.body: I don't know those projects you've said and if they are really solving world issues, that's not a new claim as there have been many too projects claiming that. Technology and projects do adapt whatever is on the trend and it's hard to say what will be the next projects that will be on the spotlight solving problems of the world. But before that, most projects should solve their own problems first like having their own chain problems.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: You didn't even mention those coin sites. There is 3 project that has the Sentinel, and I didn't find a crypto project with the name of Dyson. How do we suppose to take a look at what it is all about?Since the only certain project is Akash, I didn't found it to truly solve the world's problem, in fact, I didn't even know what its true utilities. I get computing power/resource marketplace has some potency of customers, but it does not necessarily mean it requires a blockchain or a token. The fact that it incorporates a token with how they operates, makes it shady since it is the norm that cryptocurrencies scam project, always use real-world problems as their solution.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PMBelow are the three projects that I am following and I want to know whether they are worthy of investment. I know if they succeed in the smallest margin they would maximize my investment.   SentinelAkashDysonDepends on the project goal. Not all same type or ideology can solve the flaws of blockchain cause there will always be one. Bitcoin is decentralized and solve the potential problem of control. Though these projects are advance or has some tight grip on their sleeve its imperative to know much info that could be a potential gain especially if they are worth to invest with on a period of 2 to 3 years.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PM~snipAnd what in your opinion is the world problem solved by bitcoin? I would like to hear a more detailed answer.Most of the projects are trying to take advantage of various world problems and hype on it. At this stage, none of them really come close to this, and for many problems crypto-projects is not needed at all. Of course, some projects will be useful, but at the moment, they are still in their infancy.You seem to want easy answers for easy profits. Even ask the payback period of the investment.Investments without your own market research are more likely to fail. It is unlikely that someone will be able to voice you the real ROI, because these are risky investments and extremely unpredictable.

comments.author: Dave1
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PMI find happiness whenever I see a project meant to solve world issues as Bitcoin did and has been doing. I have been tracking the progress of a few projects but I am not happy with the outcome for now. Maybe in the future, they might gear up and prove they are worthy of investment. If you have any other in your mind then do list them with your reason for investing. Please do give me an ROI timeframe.Thanks in advance.Bitcoin though was design to be a P2P, payment scheme but Satoshi, it could have solved many problems though, but not sure if Satoshi does mean for Bitcoin to be come a asset or commodities.Both there could be projects in other industries that might help like in the pharma or medicine or any other businesses that uses a lot of data for their decisions  for their goods and services.But to be honest though, as what the other posters said, we are not aware about this projects.You could have at least gave us your honest feedback and what world problems it will solved.

comments.author: TravelMug
comments.body: To be honest, I don't know if there are still projects out there who's goal is to solve the real world issues. I mean with so many projects right now and it's been like 10 years already, or least them the altcoin boom that started in 2017, there could be thousands already claiming to have their projects solved many problems and it could be effective or not, who don't have the numbers.At least we have like problems popping up every year, I think crypto or blockchain projects has pretty much step up the plate to cover every facets of humanity's problem, again it's just the question whether it's effective or not.

comments.author: Jackl87
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PMI find happiness whenever I see a project meant to solve world issues as Bitcoin did and has been doing. I have been tracking the progress of a few projects but I am not happy with the outcome for now. Maybe in the future, they might gear up and prove they are worthy of investment. Which one do you think is good enough for 2-3 years of investment and for a short-term return on investment? If you have any other in your mind then do list them with your reason for investing. Please do give me an ROI timeframe.Thanks in advance.I have not heard of any of the project that you have listed to be completely honest so i can not really tell you if those projects are really good for a longterm investment or not. I think though that just because a crypto project is trying to solve a real issue or is trying to be a green project and therefore good for the environment does not automatically mean, that it is successful. A few years back a project called Energi was pretty popular for a while. There appraoch was to be environmetally friendly because they were full PoS and they also had Masternodes. Nowadays though the project is not really successful anymore and the price is only going down.If you want to pick a project that is relatively safe to hold for a few years, then i would look for bigger and already established project. I recently bought Cosmos and now i am looking into buying NEAR because the price per coin is now below 2$ again.

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Quote from: elevates on March 08, 2023, 02:28:18 PMI find happiness whenever I see a project meant to solve world issues as Bitcoin did and has been doing. Please do give me an ROI timeframe.Thanks in advance.What are the real world issues that these projects were solving? I didn't heard any of them so I can't comment about the returns in 2 or 3 years but I just want to remind you something almost every project created after Bitcoin is just copy cat of Bitcoin or doesn't have any usability with few exceptions like monero, ethereum.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Every project is focusing on an issue and tends to say that they're the answer to it. But bitcoin has solved what most of these projects are aiming for and that's both, a payment method and an asset. There will be arguments that'd say that if there's another project that has come earlier than bitcoin then it won't be bitcoin on its seat now. But to be honest, there have been the same project concepts that have been introduced before but they've failed or just got little attention unlike what bitcoin has reached. Honestly, bitcoin is more than enough already, there could be scaling issues and network adjustments needed to be made but looking at it, it's much better than before.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Bitcoin obviously. When it comes to actual real world usage I don’t think any other coin or token even belongs in the same sentence. Since this is the altcoin section though, I’d say if I had a gun to my head to pick an alt that is doing anything to solve issues I would say MATIC. They have a pretty impressive list of partners. Namecoin also solves a major issue, but nobody seems to care.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: I am sorry as my answer is going to disappoint you! My three coins are - 1. Bitcoin 2. ETH3. XMRI honestly do not consider any other coin capable of handling and solving real-world problems. Bitcoin is for liquidity as it is widely accepted. ETH is for the smart contracting facility and XMR is for anonymity. I don't think a human needs any more cryptocurrency.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Quote from: colorinurcheeks on March 10, 2023, 09:49:47 AMQuote from: blockman on March 08, 2023, 10:28:44 PMEvery project is focusing on an issue and tends to say that they're the answer to it. I am not sure how did you come up with such statement about bitcoin, but would you care to explain? Bitcoin is the most widely used and accepted cryptocurrency in the market today. It has so huge influence on the crypto market that if bitcoin goes doen, it takes the entire market with it. I honestly think you need to re-think your statement about bitcoin!

comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Interesting. I've seen a few projects before but the most they discussed were about economic issues, and not really helping/solving them directly but rather just investing in them of sorts. I hardly doubt they'd ever touch upon it being actually THAT helpful, to the point where its influence can actually be felt. Most projects are like that though, and some are actually just saying it for the sake of making them look good. Ofc I don't think anything else has created that much of a change unlike Bitcoin with its p2p system, or ETH with their smart contracts.

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: I am aware of the above three projects. I still believe the only project that can solve real world financial issue is Bitcoin. For Blockchain I would always recommend Ethereum. Apart from these two I found a few that might be able solve real world issues. Here are two projects that I have been following for quite sometime now. I would recommend you to DYOR before investing in them. 1.CASA2.REGENClick on those links to know more about them rather than asking what these two projects are all about.

comments.author: raidarksword
comments.body: One thing I could think of is Bitcoin wherein it can solve real world issues and has an outstanding world case in any crypto in the market. Hence it was created to have a good financial system and replace the old one which is by far the most and closes to solve the world issues of financial aspects we are facing right now.

comments.author: colorinurcheeks
comments.body: Quote from: avikz on March 10, 2023, 01:25:16 PM Bitcoin is the most widely used and accepted cryptocurrency in the market today. It has so huge influence on the crypto market that if bitcoin goes doen, it takes the entire market with it.  Bitcoin's dominance is first mover advantage. Bitcoin isn't a currency, it's a proof-of-concept.
